required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sitagliptin Therapy to Improve Outcomes After Islet Autotransplant
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo Controlled Intervention Study to Assess the Impact of Sitagliptin 100 mg/Day for 1 Year on Insulin Independence Following Pancreatectomy and Autoislet Transplantation

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to test the effects of sitagliptin on the need for insulin (the hormone that lowers blood sugars) by patients who receive a pancreatectomy and islet autotransplant for chronic pancreatitis.

detailed_description.textblock:
At the current time, about one-third of patients are insulin independent (do not need to take insulin) after autotransplant, but the other two-thirds still need some insulin. Sitagliptin works by increasing the amount of a hormone called glucagon-like peptide 1, or GLP-1, in the body which then increases the amount of insulin that is made by the beta cells(the insulin producing cell of the islets). GLP-1 might also help protect beta cells from dying under stressful conditions and increase the production of new beta cells.
The primary goal of this study is to see if taking sitagliptin for one year after islet autotransplant increases the number of patients who achieve and maintain insulin independence. Other goals of this study are to see if sitagliptin reduces the amount of insulin injections needed or helps the islets make more insulin.

secondary_outcome.description: AUC C-peptide obtained from a mixed meal test (measured time 0 to 2 hours after Boost HP)
AUC C-peptide (ng/dL*min) from mixed meal tolerance test (measured times 0 to 2 hours after Boost HP)
Derived from intravenous gluocose tolerance testing (0 to 10 minute measures after dextrose bolus)
Derived from intravenous glucose tolerance test (0 to 10 minute measures after IV dextrose bolus)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 years
- Scheduled for total pancreatectomy and IAT at UM
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-existing diabetes mellitus or hyperglycemia with fasting glucose ≥115 mg/dl
- Medical conditions which, in the opinion of the investigator, might impact islet function (e.g asthma or inflammatory disease requiring chronic systemic corticosteroids)
- Significant renal disease: serum creatinine levels of >3.0 mg/dL in men and >2.5 mg/dL in women, or end-stage renal disease requiring hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis.
- For female subjects, plans to become pregnant or unwillingness to practice birth control for 18 months.
- Islet yield <1,000 IE/kg body weight (exclusion for treatment with drug/placebo)

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

outcome.title: Insulin Independence
outcome.population: N's reflect patients that returned for study follow up.

measure.title: Insulin Independence
measure.population: N's reflect patients that returned for study follow up.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve (AUC) C-peptide (ng/dL*Min)
outcome.description: AUC C-peptide obtained from a mixed meal test (measured time 0 to 2 hours after Boost HP)
outcome.population: Patients with vomiting, NPO restrictions (due to chronic GI illness) were not able to complete MMTT. The N for each group reflects the number of patients who successfully completed this assessment.

measure.title: Area Under the Curve (AUC) C-peptide (ng/dL*Min)
measure.description: AUC C-peptide obtained from a mixed meal test (measured time 0 to 2 hours after Boost HP)
measure.population: Patients with vomiting, NPO restrictions (due to chronic GI illness) were not able to complete MMTT. The N for each group reflects the number of patients who successfully completed this assessment.

outcome.title: AUC C-peptide
outcome.description: AUC C-peptide (ng/dL*min) from mixed meal tolerance test (measured times 0 to 2 hours after Boost HP)
outcome.population: Patients with vomiting, NPO (Nothing by Mouth) restrictions (due to chronic GI illness) were not able to complete MMTT. (Mixed meal Tolerance Test) The N for each group reflects the number of patients who successfully completed this assessment.

measure.title: AUC C-peptide
measure.description: AUC C-peptide (ng/dL*min) from mixed meal tolerance test (measured times 0 to 2 hours after Boost HP)
measure.population: Patients with vomiting, NPO (Nothing by Mouth) restrictions (due to chronic GI illness) were not able to complete MMTT. (Mixed meal Tolerance Test) The N for each group reflects the number of patients who successfully completed this assessment.

outcome.title: Acute C-peptide Response (ACR) to Glucose
outcome.description: Derived from intravenous gluocose tolerance testing (0 to 10 minute measures after dextrose bolus)
outcome.population: This test required two IVs. In patients for whom 2 IVs could not be placed successfully, this test could not be performed. N's reflect number of patients completing this test.

measure.title: Acute C-peptide Response (ACR) to Glucose
measure.description: Derived from intravenous gluocose tolerance testing (0 to 10 minute measures after dextrose bolus)
measure.population: This test required two IVs. In patients for whom 2 IVs could not be placed successfully, this test could not be performed. N's reflect number of patients completing this test.

measure.population: This test required two IVs. In patients for whom 2 IVs could not be placed successfully, this test could not be performed. N's reflect number of patients completing this test.

reported_events.desc: from treatment start to 18 month follow up

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: It is also possible that the study is not powered enough to detect small differences in insulin independence. The feasibility of conducting any larger trial in the small population of adult islet autograft recipients is limited, however.
